results.title: Pilkington Brothers offer: the best of both worlds
results.creator_credit: Frank Worth, Cecil Musk and British Information Services

video_links.name: Pilkington Brothers offer: the best of both worlds

results.brief_description: Two visitors from outer space visit Earth in order to investigate a material unknown on their planet - glass. They are shown the many architectural uses of glass and the many varieties which are available for use.

results.title: Giron: bay of pigs
results.creator_credit: Manuel Herrera, Humberto Hernandez, Orlando de la Huertes and Instituto Cubano del Arte e Industrias Cinematográficos (ICAIC)
results.brief_description: A dramatised documentary account of the failed CIA-sponsored assault at the Bay of Pigs in April, 1961. The operation subsequently created serious embarrassment for the U.S. government and led to wide-ranging political repercussions. Employing interviews with participants in the original events, re-enactments of the fighting and actual documentary footage of the assault, the film reconstructs the entire event, from the first air raid strikes to the retaking of Playa Giron by the revolutionary troops. Dramatised and documentary sequences are seamlessly blended to provide a dramatically compelling war narrative. Made with the participation of the Revolutionary Armed Forces.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Manuel Herrera, Humberto Hernandez, Orlando de la Huertes and Instituto Cubano del Arte e Industrias Cinematográficos (ICAIC)

results.title: In the shadow of Hollywood [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Sylvie Groulx, Eric Michel and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: With its barrage of special effects, its new heroes and warrior myths, the American dream is not what it used to be. Aided by new trade strategies, Hollywood is tightening its stranglehold on the world’s screens, leaving no room for indigenous cultures. Disturbed by this one-sided war of images, the director consults filmmakers and other experts on both sides of the Atlantic. Agnieszka Holland, Arthur Penn, Alain Tanner, Bertrand Tavernier, Milos Forman and Denys Arcand ponder the fate of cinema in the era of globalization. Can auteur cinema with its personal vision, its expression of the collective identity, withstand the onslaught of American movies and their single-minded focus on entertainment? Includes interviews with Denys Arcand, Anne-Marie Bidaud, Luciana Castellina, Milos Forman, Claude Fournier, Agnieszka Holland, Marin Karmitz, Todd McCarthy, Jonathan Nossiter, Arthur Penn, Leslie Quinton, Roland Smith, Jean-Charles Tacchella, Alain Tanner, Bertrand Tavernier, Daniel Toscan du Plantier, Margarethe Von Trotta, Andrzej Wajda and Irwin Winkler. In English and French with English subtitles.

results.title: Wild life in bushland
results.creator_credit: Victorian Government Tourist Bureau and Victorian Railways
results.brief_description: A study of the Healesville Sanctuary for Australian native animals and birds that was originally established by Sir Colin Mackenzie in 1921 to protect injured and endangered native animals in a natural bush environment. Almost 50 Australian animals are captured on film including platypus, lyrebirds and a fighting kangaroo. Commentary: Ray Chapman. Photographed and edited by A. M. Fairfoul. Produced with the collaboration of the sanctuary’s director, David H. Fleay.

results.title: Drink no Longer Water
results.creator_credit: Australian Wine and Brandy Corporation and Fontana Films
results.brief_description: A humourous romp through various wine styles set in the country in a castle-like structure. Vignettes played out by actors - some in period costume to emulate the character of various wine varieties/styles from Moselle “for first lovers” through to claret are you old enough? Featuring Australian actors Steve Bisley and Mel Gibson in their youth.

results.title: The Heritage of the uncommon man
results.creator_credit: Reid H Ray and BNA Communications
results.brief_description: Joe Powell, a noted lecturer to businessmen, expounds his notions of the “Uncommon man” - the man who gets results. In an entertaining lecture, Powell describes the attributes and behaviour of the successful executive. Uses cartoons to illustrate some points of the lecture.

results.title: People (Yallourn's Royal Hour 1954; Born to Die; Sir John Monash)

video_links.name: People (Yallourn's Royal Hour 1954; Born to Die; Sir John Monash)

results.brief_description: “Yallourn’s Royal Hour” highlights the visit to Yallourn of Queen Elizabeth II and the Duke of Edinburgh on 3rd March 1954. Film of the royal motorcade through Melbourne is shown before their arrival in Yallourn where they inspect the coal extraction site at Yallourn Cut (16 min). “Born to Die” focuses on the prospect that Yallourn will be demolished to enable access to the coal reserves beneath it. Includes comments by the townspeople on their feelings about this. (48 mins) “Sir John Monash” is a tribute to the life of this pioneer Australian. The Vice Chancellor of Monash University speaks on his life and an account of his achievements is given. (27 min)

results.title: Looking at plants
results.creator_credit: Jim Harris, John Bird and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School
results.brief_description: Filmed in the Sherbrooke Forest Park, Australflora Nursery, Victoria, and shows glimpses of the plant and insect life which abound there. No narration, music only.

results.title: [Black Knight]
results.brief_description: A survey of the development of the British “Black Knight” rocket test vehicle and its use in high speed flight and ballistic missile research. The elements of construction, ground support equipment, propulsion, guidance and instrumentation are discussed. Tests and launching preparations at Australia’s Woomera Range follow, closing with a night-firing sequence. NB: No opening or closing credits
